pr_body:
<!--   Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the pull request:
1. Follow our contribution guidelines
2. Test your changes and attach their results to the pull request.
3. Update the relevant documentation.
-->

**Description**
This PR continues the discussion on the glee authentication issue #377 , it continues the discussion about glee authentication, from #460 .

Following the idea from @Souvikns  to use a separate directory for authentication. Each file in this directory can hold both server and client authentication logic.

````js
/** auth/serverName.ts **/

export function serverAuth({headers, done}) {
  // write logic for authentication 
  done()
}

export function clientAuth() {
  return {
    username: '',
    password: ''
  }
}
````

**Steps to test run authentication**
- In the glee root directory, `cd examples/anime-http/server`,  
- The server directory, contains an `auth` directory that holds a `trendingAnimeServer.ts` file. The file contains some logic you can edit how you like but it must export the same functions as the code above
- `npm run dev` to start the server in dev mode
- The same logic applies to the client directory, `cd examples/anime-http/server`
- Then look for `auth/trendingAnime.js` update accordingly then start the server.

**Related issue(s)**
`Resolves #377`

@Souvikns @KhudaDad414

pr_body:
**Description**

This PR contains the docs on how to use the new authentication features in Glee.

It is currently a work in progress and changes will be made alongside https://github.com/asyncapi/glee/pull/474.

Related issue(s)
This PR aims to document #474 

@Souvikns @KhudaDad414
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1296061287, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
# Authentication
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 8, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296067080, 'comment_body': 'Just like `functions` and `lifecycle` folder, I should be able to change the location of my `auth` function as well.
please add this option in:
https://github.com/asyncapi/glee/blob/d83701dec664695c9928999fee30f4453d655d83/docs/config-file.md?plain=1#L98

also reflect the changes in https://github.com/asyncapi/glee/pull/474', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 12, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296068795, 'comment_body': 'add a link to the said documentation. (I mean the spec docs that specifies the types of authentications that asyncapi supports)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 14, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296069675, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
A sample `asyncapi.yaml` for a server with security requirements and security schemes is shown below:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 14, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296071334, 'comment_body': 'For the sake of simplicity, It would be great to demonstrate only one here. and maybe a simple one. like `userPass`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 16, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296074308, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
A sample `asyncapi.yaml` for a client that implements some of the requirements of the server above:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 18, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296077106, 'comment_body': 'maybe we can call this function `done` here as well?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 20, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1296085494, 'comment_body': 'Instread of providing an example here I think it would be great to have a few other documents providing a getting started guide for that type of authentication?
maybe:
`auth/user-pass.md` explaining the user-pass authentication using a user name and password. it can be for `http` `or websocket`.
`auth/oauth.md` would do the same but for the oauth flow...
etc...

', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 16, 15, 27, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1297433008, 'comment_body': "hey @KhudaDad414 , alright I'll add it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 17, 16, 0, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'oviecodes', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298184345, 'comment_body': "Can't understand the point of this comment here. ðŸ¤” ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 8, 44, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298187059, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Glee looks for authentication files in the `auth` directory by default but it can be configured using [glee config file](../config-file.md).
The name of the authentication file should be the name of the targeted server that the authentication logic should work for.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 8, 46, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298190018, 'comment_body': 'It is not that obvious to a newcomer what serverAuth or clientAuth is. please define these terminologies in a paragraph and explain when glee can act as as server and how it can act as a client.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 8, 49, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298191199, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
## Supported Authentication Values in asyncapi.yaml file
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 8, 51, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298208200, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Bearer Token authentication is one of the most popular forms of authentication and is widely used because of its percieved security. This guide will walk through how to implement bearer token authentication in Glee.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 9, 7, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298212904, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
**The Client asyncapi.yaml file does't need to implement all the security requirements in the server, it only needs to implement the ones that it uses.**
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 9, 12, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298219380, 'comment_body': "the name of the file doesn't match with the content, plus the content is the same as `userPassword.md` right?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 9, 18, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298221597, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
User and password authentication is one of the most basic forms of authentication. This guide will walk through how to implement username and password authentication in Glee.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 9, 20, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KhudaDad414', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1298259714, 'comment_body': '@KhudaDad414 , the content is different, this is supposed to be for `httpAPIKey` security scheme
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 18, 9, 53, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'oviecodes', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1299688098, 'comment_body': 'I think you forgot to change this from username/password. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 7, 1, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Souvikns', 'type': 'User'}]
